title: The Eyes of Glouphrie/Quick guide
content:
The RuneScape Wiki also has an article on: rsw:The Eyes of Glouphrie/Quick guide
 This quick guide has an in-depth guide here.
It contains a more detailed description of dialogue, cutscenes, and storyline.

Details[edit | edit source]

Start point Speak to Brimstail in his cave south-west side of the Tree Gnome Stronghold, directly west of the bank near the Stronghold Slayer Cave.
Official difficultyIntermediate
DescriptionAfter you foiled a plan to destroy the Grand Tree things have been quiet in the gnome world. Brimstail has found a strange machine, though, built by Oaknock the Engineer during the Gnomes' Golden Age. What does the weird device do? Why on RuneScape was it built? If you agree to help this bookworm gnome get this confusing device working, you will learn a little about gnome magicks, gnome history, and you will start to uncover a new threat (or is it an old one?) to gnome security - a threat that is a lot harder to see ...
Official lengthMedium
Requirements
  • Completed The Grand Tree quest
  • 5 Construction (not boostable)
  • 46 Magic (not boostable)
Items required
  • Bucket of sap or a knife and an empty bucket
  • Mud rune
  • Maple logs
  • Oak logs
  • Hammer
  • Saw
  • Pestle and mortar
Recommended
  • Several free inventory slots (about 8) to solve the puzzles easier
  • Fast travel to the Tree Gnome Stronghold (Balloon Transport System, Gnome Glider, Spirit Tree or Slayer Ring to the Slayer Cave to directly reach the Stronghold -- alternatively, use a Necklace of Passage to the Outpost and walk north)
  • Fast travel to Hazelmere (Fairy rings to cls, or Watchtower or Nightmare Zone minigame teleport and walk east if you have no access to fairy rings)
    • Slayer ring to the Slayer Dungeon or a Necklace of Passage to the Wizards' Tower for easy access to fairy rings
Enemies to defeat Evil creature (x6)
Ironman concerns

45 , or 50 , or Managing Miscellania to get a maple log.

13 Runecraft needed for ironmen to craft a mud rune, unless obtained by a monster drop, essence impling, or purchased from the Mage Training Arena with Pizazz points.

Magic glue can be made before starting the quest by grinding the mud rune with the pestle and mortar and using it on a bucket of sap, saving inventory space.

Brimstail has found a strange machine, though, built by [[Oaknock]] the Engineer during the Gnomes' Golden Age. What does the weird device do? Why on ''RuneScape'' was it built? If you agree to help this bookworm gnome get this confusing device working, you will learn a little about gnome magicks, gnome history, and you will start to uncover a new threat (or is it an old one?) to gnome security - a threat that is a lot harder to see ...","difficulty":"Intermediate","kills":"[[Evil creature]] (x6)","name":"The Eyes of Glouphrie/Quick guide","start":"Speak to [[Brimstail]] in his [[Brimstail's cave|cave]] south-west side of the [[Tree Gnome Stronghold]], directly west of the bank near the [[Stronghold Slayer Cave]].","length":"Medium","ironman":"<span class=\"scp\" data-skill=\"Woodcutting\" data-level=\"45\">[[File:Woodcutting icon.png|21x21px|link=Woodcutting|alt=Woodcutting]] 45 </span>, or <span class=\"scp\" data-skill=\"Firemaking\" data-level=\"50\">[[File:Firemaking icon.png|21x21px|link=Firemaking|alt=Firemaking]] 50 </span>, or [[Managing Miscellania]] to get a [[maple log]].\n\n<span class=\"scp\" data-skill=\"Runecraft\" data-level=\"13\">[[File:Runecraft icon.png|21x21px|link=Runecraft|alt=Runecraft]] 13 </span> [[Runecraft]] needed for ironmen to craft a [[mud rune]], unless obtained by a monster drop, essence impling, or purchased from the [[Mage Training Arena]] with [[Pizazz points]].\n[[File:Ultimate ironman chat badge.png]] [[Magic glue]] can be made before starting the quest by grinding the [[mud rune]] with the [[pestle and mortar]] and using it on a [[bucket of sap]], saving inventory space.","items":"*[[Bucket of sap]] '''or''' a [[knife]] and an empty [[bucket]]\n*[[Mud rune]]\n*[[Maple logs]]\n*[[Oak logs]]\n*[[Hammer]]\n*[[Saw]]\n*[[Pestle and mortar]]"}

Walkthrough[edit | edit source]

Digression[edit | edit source]

  • Talk to Brimstail in the cave found in the south-west corner of the Gnome Stronghold. ( 1•1•1•1)…
    1What's that cute creature wandering around?
    1Yes, that sounds fascinating...
    1Oh, yes I love a bit of History.
    1Of course!

Elven Mystery[edit | edit source]

  • Inspect the singing bowl in the western portion of the cave.
  • To the north, attempt to unlock Oaknock's Machine.
  • Talk to Brimstail. ( 1•1)…
    1I've had a look in the other room now.
    1Of course, I'd love to!

Memories[edit | edit source]

  • Talk to Hazelmere, located upstairs in his house (on the small island east of Yanille, fairy ring code cls goes directly to his house, Nightmare Zone minigame teleport or Watchtower Teleport). There will be several cutscenes, last being King Healthorg and the white Spirit Tree Argento .
  • Return to Brimstail. ( 1)…
    1I've visited Hazelmere, he told me all sorts of interesting things.

Incapacitated[edit | edit source]

Items needed: Hammer, Pestle and Mortar, Saw, Mud rune, Bucket of sap, Maple logs, Oak logs
  • Use your Mud Rune on the Pestle and Mortar to make Ground Mud Runes.
  • Add the Ground Mud Runes to the Bucket of Sap.
  • Repair Oaknock's machine (click on the machine twice).
  • Talk to Brimstail. ( 1)…
    1I think I've fixed the machine now!

Anti-Illusion[edit | edit source]

  • Talk to Brimstail twice more to receive more discs. ( 1)…
    1I
  • Optional: Drop the discs and talk to Brimstail to receive even more discs. ( 1)…
    1I can't work out what to do with these discs!

Front Panel[edit | edit source]

  • Unlock machine.

Control Panel[edit | edit source]

  • Unlock the front panel by inserting a disc with a value equal to the green number. (When done, click the green box next to the number.)
  • Talk to Brimstail for more discs. ( 1)…
    1I
  • Complete the three puzzles inside the unlocked machine
    • You need to fill up every slot, the first puzzle's single slot, the second's two slots, and the last puzzle's three slots.
    • You will need to exchange some of the tokens to obtain certain values. (see full guide here).
Below is the value of each shape:
Colour Value
Circle Triangle Square Pentagon
Red 1 3 4 5
Orange 2 6 8 10
Yellow 3 9 12 15
Green 4 12 16 20
Blue 5 15 20 25
Indigo 6 18 24 30
Violet 7 21 28 35
  • Talk to Brimstail. ( 1)…
    1Phew! I've got that machine working now. What do I need to do now?

Assassination[edit | edit source]

  • Talk to Brimstail again. ( 1)…
    1Phew! I've got that machine working now. What do I need to do now?
  • Kill all Evil Creatures: (wait for the whole death animation to end before running or teleporting away!). Their colour is now black.
    • The one by Brimstail, if you haven't killed it already.
    • One outside of the main gate (south-east from Brimstail's cave). Note: It must be killed within stronghold walls. If it is outside, simply kill it, let it spawn, and kill it again for credit.
    • One by the gnome agility course entrance (near the spirit tree).
    • One by King Narnode, at the bottom of the Grand Tree. If it is stuck behind a trapdoor, kill it with mage or range, or hop worlds. Make sure you wait a few seconds after killing before using the ladder.
    • One at the top of the Grand Tree, by the prison. Make sure you wait a few seconds after killing before using the ladder.
    • One by the giant tortoises north-west of the Grand Tree (in the pen north of the swamp).
  • Talk to King Narnode.
    • Optional: Use the crystal saw seed on the singing bowl by Brimstail to get an enchanted crystal saw, and complete a medium Western Provinces diary task.

Quest complete!

Rewards[edit | edit source]

  • 2 Quest points
  • 12,000 Magic experience
  • 2,500 Woodcutting experience
  • 6,000 Runecraft experience
  • 250 Construction experience
  • A crystal saw seed â€” Either take it to Ilfeen in Tirannwn or use it on the singing bowl by Brimstail to get an enchanted crystal saw. It allows items (that require a saw) to be made three levels above your Construction. It has a limited number of charges (28), but the recharge is free - use the bowl again.
